definition: A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: variant of 兔[tu4]
rabbit
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(negative prefix)/not/no
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods
suffix of a noun of locality

variant of 草[cao3]

sentences.english: A rabbit doesn't eat the grass near its own hole.

definition: you should not covet your friend's wife (idiom)
pinyin: peng2 you5 qi1 bu4 ke3 qi1

definition: lit. a good horse doesn't turn around and graze the same patch again (idiom)/fig. once you've moved on, don't go back again (romantic relationship, job etc)/leave the past behind
pinyin: hao3 ma3 bu4 chi1 hui2 tou2 cao3

definition: lit. a dog can't stop himself from eating shit (idiom)/fig. bad habits are hard to change
pinyin: gou3 gai3 bu4 liao3 chi1 shi3

definition: paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
lit. don't let one's own fertile water flow into others' field/fig. keep the goodies within the family (proverb)
pinyin: fei2 shui3 bu4 liu2 wai4 ren2 tian2

definition: women love bad guys
pinyin: nan2 ren2 bu4 huai4 , nu:3 ren2 bu4 ai4

definition: common saying/proverb
to undermine/to let someone down/to seduce someone away from something
lit. the flowers in one's garden cannot match the fragrance of wild flowers (idiom)/fig. other women seem more attractive than one's own partner/the grass is always greener on the other side
pinyin: jia1 hua1 mei2 you3 ye3 hua1 xiang1

definition: to neglect one's friends when smitten with a new love
lit. strong dragon cannot repress a snake (idiom); fig. a local gangster who is above the law
pinyin: qiang2 long2 bu4 ya1 di4 tou2 she2

definition: lit. a crafty rabbit has three burrows/a sly individual has more than one plan to fall back on (idiom)
one may know a person for a long time without understanding his true nature (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhi1 mian4 bu4 zhi1 xin1

definition: lit. if you have to use force to break a melon off the vine, it won't taste sweet (because it's only when the melon is ripe that it can be removed with just a slight twist) (idiom)/fig. if sth is not meant to be, it's no use trying to force it to happen
pinyin: qiang3 niu3 de5 gua1 bu4 tian2

definition: no poison, no great man (idiom); A great man has to be ruthless.
only the official is allowed to light the fire/Gods may do what cattle may not/quod licet Iovi, non licet bovi
pinyin: zhi3 xu3 zhou1 guan1 fang4 huo3 , bu4 xu3 bai3 xing4 dian3 deng1
